reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For some trips already my girlfriend and I have used tripadvisor to select hotels and attractions and so we did with Komaneka at Tanggayuda.
reviews.title: Heaven!
Tranquil Komaneka
reviews.text: The summary is: we agree with most of the comments, the hotel in our opinion deserves a 5 star score.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: I´ll try to be brief:
reviews.title: Faultless
Slice of Paradise
reviews.text: Reservation process: We arranged everything by email directly with the hotel. All communications were clear and stated all we needed to know. We scheduled a car pickup from DPS airport at Bali and there was our driver waiting for us at 10PM on a rainy day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Airport-Hotel Shuttle: He drove us to the Hotel after a long trip (from Argentina it´s about 24 hours flight + stops). The drive to Tanggayuda takes about 70-90 minutes from the airport. Driving in Bali is not easy if you come from a developed country.
reviews.title: Fantastic Escape!

likes.liked: — The Serenity of it, very quite and peaceful, fantastic villa, didn't want to leave it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Words will never be able to express our stay at Komaneka!!!
reviews.title: Our Family in Ubud

likes.liked: — The room itself and the people

reviews.title: Loved the Komaneka
reviews.text: It was our honeymoon and Komaneka was a suprise for my new bride as I did not tell her where I was taking her.

reviews.title: Most incredible Stay
reviews.text: I made my reservation approx. 6 months prior to check in and I planned my entire stay of 4D3N via telephone with Mr. Surya (Operations Manager). It's probably the best decision I made as there were quite a few choices for hotels in Ubud, but I decided to choose Komaneka simply because I was impressed with the way I was I was handled on each phone call to the resort and how helpful Mr. Surya was.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After talking to one another over the phone for months prior to check in, we became more of family than friends. He assisted me in almost everything I wanted for my honeymoon and planned some designed a package that was perfect for honeymooners.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right from the Airport Pickup / Clearance to baggage transfers was a breeze as Surya had already arranged the neccesary for a smooth transistion.
reviews.title: Beautiful for honeymoon!!!

likes.liked: — Design, landscape, visual and aural beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having read all the reviews on here for months I couldnt wait to finally go to Bali and spend 6 nights at the Tanggayuda. I booked through Asia rooms and that was a very good experience as well.
reviews.title: relaxing Tanggayuda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say? Everything I read on here is true: this hotel is just so lovely! Its everything: the villa, the staff, the surroundings, the noises of birds at night that I had never heard before.
reviews.title: Perfection? It exists

likes.disliked: — location, a little bit far away from everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: I think I loved the big volcano tub the most. It was huge and to lay in there at night with two candles burning, listening to the sounds of nature and nothing more, gave me a feeling of being very far away of the real world.
reviews.title: A secluded paradise in Ubud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole room smelled after those beautiful tropical flowers that were in our room. They have thought of everything like umbrellas in the room (and did we need them!) and mosquito spray and robes ect ect.
reviews.title: Truly magical - the benchmark for all hotels

likes.liked: — Privacy, Service and beauty of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After only one day the staff called us by our first names and we were so surprised! They were so polite and gave us the feeling that we were special. The shuttlebus service is great too.
reviews.title: Loved Komaneka at Tanggayuda

likes.liked: — The beautiful setting and the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In August my fiance and I spent 5 nights with the Komaneka Tanggayuda. The experience was nothing less than our most memorable stay while in Bali and fealt the resort the most accomadating and courteous to their guests. While there are so many things to praise and nothing to complain about, there are things to note.
reviews.title: Komaneka Tanggayuda...Our most memorable holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The grounds and room are magnificant. The architecture and layout are stunning and tranquil. The resort captures the lush surroundings of Ubud and is set nicely outside the city center area (much more removed and quiet). We stayed in room 105 for an early honeymoon. We were told that it was one of the best with the resort and truly was the best room I have ever stayed in. The layout was aesthetically amazing with the lava tubs filled with flowers, large showers, and a view to die for. There were some small observations such as a spot on the daybed or tear in my nightgown, but we don't get ruffled about these items. Overall the room is well kept and clean, but a note if you are very particular. I would say that this resort would be of the highest standard relative to the area though.
reviews.title: Komaneka - Unforgettable

likes.liked: — Spacious, clean interior, bed, view of padi field overlooking the villa,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: 2. The food and service was wonderful. We had a special smoked duck dinner one evening. They completely decorated our patio with flowers and candles and then we enjoyed an evening with a private server oversaw our dinner in our daybed. Truly fantastic and recommended for an unforgetable dinner. The restaurant served great dishes and the staff was more than accomadating. There is an item to note...the service style in Bali is much more relaxed than Western cultures . They are more than willing to provide whatever you need and are extremely polite, but again much more relaxed. Upon your stay you should not be critical but politely ask if you require more on your visit.
reviews.title: My first review after many stays at Trip Advisor hotels

likes.disliked: — Perhaps they need a lift, the stairs could be difficult for older people

reviews.title: True Bliss
reviews.text: 3. The resort provides transportation into the Ubud tourist center and monkey forest. Both fun parts to experiencing Ubud. The staff was overall extremely friendly, courteous, and always seemed to want to do anything to please. We purchased a few large oil/canvas art pieces in the Ubud market that we were unable to travel with. The staff unrolled the individual peices and packed them together in a single package, then shipped them 2 day through Fed Ex. They handled everything, all we did is hand them over. They added the costs to our bill and we returned home to our art waiting for us. Truly great attention and fealt very welcome by all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: Like the classic old song: "Unforgettable, in many ways...". My hub and I are still mesmerised with our stay in Komaneka Tanggayuda since our return to Singapore on 25 July 2008. As this year marks our 15th wedding anniversary (24 July 2008, the actual day), I wanted to give my hub a memorable celebration and we were given the best memory of our days when we gave this all important task to the staff of Komaneka. We have no idea what they'll do on our special day and we were not a bit disappointed with their arrangement. Tea light candles were placed artistically in the restaurant (the restaurant was closed to the public for us). Soft music was played, an attentative, personal butler was provided, table was set romatically. The ambience was perfect for our candle light dinner. Our butler knew when to serve and chat with us, making sure that all things were well and comfortable for us and he also knew when to make room for just the two of us (my hub and I). We were so blessed with what was arranged and it was beyond our expectations.
reviews.title: Excellent Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at Komaneka Tanggayuda. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful. The rooms were beautiful. We stayed in a room that had a tiled outdoor area with a plunge pool, cabana, and outdoor bathtub. The resort has a beautiful view from the back terrace looking over a valley. They offered a good free shuttle service and multiple activities including free daily afternoon tea (tea plus various balinese snacks cooked in front of you), cooking class, guided hikes, etc. The whole place is also has free wireless internet.
reviews.title: Tanggayuda vs. Monkey Forest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those of you deciding whether to stay at Tanggayuda or Monkey Forest, I thought I'd briefly describe the differences. Komaneka Monkey Forest is the original resort. It is located off Monkey Forest Road which is the main road running through downtown area of Ubud. Therefore most of the shops and restaurants you will want to see are all in walking distance, including actual Monkey Forest. On the other hand Tanggayuda was opened about two years ago and is located about 15 minutes from central Ubud. It might seem far, but the hotel offers a free shuttle service that runs every hour between Tangayuda and Central Ubud, a nice drive past rice paddies and roadside shops. They will drop you off wherever you want and pick up as well. It also means that at Tanggayuda you stay away from the more crowded downtown near the Ayung River Valley where there are beautiful hikes and whitewater rafting. In fact, some of the other fanciest hotels (Four Seasons and Amandari) are off the same road as Komaneka Tanggayuda. Both places are great stays but hopefully this will help you make the decision between the two depending on your own preferences.
reviews.title: It's everything the reviews say "exquisite!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sometimes the best things happen by chance. That;s what happened to us, and we're so glad it did. We had an absolute magical time at the Komeneka Tangayoda.
reviews.title: Truly Magical...Best part of our Honeymoon

likes.liked: — The rooms were so pristine, the views were fab and the staff was so welcoming and sweet.
likes.disliked: — slightly far away from Ubud Center, but the free shuttle made it easy to get around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a so-so experience at the Puri Santrian in Sanur (loved the beach- wouldn't go back to the resort) we headed for the hills of Ubud. After initially booking through an internet booking service (Agoda.com) we were to stay at the Kajane Mua , in the heart of Ubud right across from the main Komeneka. Unfortunatley, 6 days after initially making my booking, and being given an alternate room from the one we first chose, we were told that the resort was full, and there we were- already in Bali, about to check out the next day of the Puri, with no reservation. I had done my homework before hand, so at least had a list of places I'd like to stay at, but the internet service at the Puri was so poor, I ended up having to blindly go by my list and see what phone numbers I came up with. Only later did we find out we were headed to Ubud the exact time that the "king" of ubud's cremation ceremony was taking place and the whole place was packed, with hotel rooms hard to come by. Even so, they gave me a decent rate at the last minute contacting them directly.
reviews.title: Getting away from it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THus we ended up at the Komanka Tangayuda, as the main one in town was full. Once there, our less than perfect experience in Bali ended and our time "in paradise" began. The hotel arranged pickup (for $30) and even stopped at a couple of places we wanted, first offereing us ice cold wash clothes and cold drinks. The car had a whole book of info about the resort and various tours. (Ask to see it later when you get there, as it was very informative, but the info isn't in your room).
reviews.title: A 'Must'!

likes.disliked: — Position of room in relation to the sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from 10 days in Ubud; 5 days at Komaneka Monkey Forest & 5 days at Komenka Tanggayuda. Both hotels were superb & offered different experiences. Monkey Forest is in the heart of Ubud with the excellent Cafe Wayan literally just outside your doorstep; Tanggayuda offers beauty & serenity but away from the bustle of central Ubud. The hotel shuttle service gets you in & out of central Ubud in 15 min. We woke to the sunrise streaming through the palm trees. Lush gardens, gorgeous pool & beautiful villas; everything is so aesthetically enchanting. But best of all is the staff who made our stay truly memorable; we met so many lovely people who were incredibly warm, friendly & welcoming. A very special terima kasih banyak to Kande & Utami!
reviews.title: Exquisite beauty & serenity

likes.liked: — Beauty & tranquility & lovely people - fantastic breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really wonderful stay at the komaneka. The staff there are very special, they are so helpful without being intrusive, polite and will always remember you name!
reviews.title: Highly Recommend Komaneka

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our villa was superb in every way. The main pool was also very special, it feels like you are swimming in a big lake in the countryside! .
reviews.title: Elegant perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed for four nights in Ubud at the start of a nine day holiday in Bali. Ubud & Komaneka is the perfect start to a Bali holiday, you can wind down in truly tranquil spot. I would highly recommend Komaneka.
reviews.title: Not recommended for families

likes.liked: — Out of the main part of Ubud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is just amazing... simple, elegant, luxurious with exceptional customer service. For example, when you go to breakfast they ask for your room number. Why? So that they can clean your room when you're eating and have it ready for you by the time you're done! The rooms are gorgeous... spacious with every comfort considered. They have a simple but perfectly functional gym, which we used almost every day, and a beautiful infinity pool which was empty since almost everyone has their own plunge pool in their villa.
reviews.title: Luxury in the wild!

likes.liked: — The privacy and ambiance of the room
